roleset.name: cause damage to (transitive), causing damage to

example.name: hurt-v: instrumental
example.text: Countries with inadequate protections for intellectual-property rights could be hurting themselves by discouraging their own scientists and authors and by deterring US high-technology firms from investing or marketing their best products there.
example.arg: Countries with inadequate protections for intellectual-property right
by discouraging their own scientists and authors and by deterring US high-technology firms from investing or marketing their best products there

example.name: hurt-v: with benefactive
example.text: Lower prices hurt margins for most products.

example.name: hurting-n: Arg0,1
example.text: This bill's hurting the lower classes seems to have been overlooked by its sponsors.

roleset.note:
HURT-V NOTES: Based on big corpus. Adjectival 'hurtful' based on BOLT-4,5. Member of VNcls amuse-31.1, hurt-40.8.3-2 (from hurt.01-v)
HURTING-N NOTES: hurt.01 (from hurting.01-n)

roleset.name: be experiencing pain (intransitive), experiencing pain

example.name: hurt-v: cf climb
example.text: After climbing the mountain, John's arms and legs hurt bad..

roleset.note:
HURT-V NOTES: Based on big corpus. Member of VNcls marvel-31.3, pain-40.8.1, and amuse-31.1 (from hurt.02-v)
HURTING-N NOTES: hurt.02 (from hurting.02-n)

roleset.name: tending to, able to cause damage to

example.name: hurtful-j
example.text: My cutie . You should just say you know that 's very hurtful she probably is clueless

example.name: hurtful-j
example.text: it s bloody hurtful and hard

roleset.note: HURTFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from hurtful.01-j)
